frameDefinitions: Commerce is a situation in which a Buyer and a Seller have agreed upon an exchange of Money and Goods (possibly after a negotiation), and then perform the exchange, optionally carrying it out with various kinds of direct payment or financing or the giving of change.
A Protagonist delays a planned action because they cannot or do not want to proceed until an Expected_event occurs.
A Feature of an Entity serves to distinguish the Entity from other members of its type which have a different value for the Feature.
This  frame covers the descriptions of tastes and smells, and has one main frame element, Source.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
frameExamples: The cat <t>waited</t> on top of the washer as Elmer popped the lid off the can of cat food and then pounded the can's contents onto the plate
His <t>distinctive</t> flowing gait and skill with the rapier set him apart from his fellows.
Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>.
The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>.
<fen>Money</fen> is given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Goods</fen> is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
The sentient being who cannot proceed with their planned activities until a Salient_entity has arrived or an Expected_event has occurred.
A concrete or abstract entity that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> expects to participate in an <fen>Expected_event</fen>, typically that of arriving at the <fen>Place</fen> of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
The <fen>Expected_event</fen> is an event that needs to take place or a state that needs to begin to hold before the <fen>Protagonist</fen> can proceed with their planned activities.
The time period during which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is waiting.
The location in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is waiting.
The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which makes it different from the other members of its class.
The item which differs from other members of its class in the <fen>Feature</fen>'s value.
<fen>Perceptual_source</fen> is used for the entity that is being described. A recipe can stand in for a <fen>Perceptual_source</fen> which is a kind of food.
<fen>Sensory_attribute</fen> is used for words that describe the perception itself.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
listRoleExamples: She was considered a <fex>purchaser</fex> of the finest things
<fex>My local grocery store</fex> raised prices on meat
The price of the sweater was <fex> $50</fex>.
She was considered a purchaser <fex>of the finest things</fex>
<fex>He</fex> politely waited, hat in hand, until he could speak.
In busier times several passengers are waiting <fex>for the train</fex>.
She did n't wait <fex>for a reply</fex>, but spelled out the answer herself.
At least 17 ships were waiting <fex>yesterday</fex> to come up the river.
Reporters are waiting <fex>outside the State Guesthouse</fex> for the talks to start .
That never depleting ammo in his arsenal - his signature <fex>smile</fex> - is contagious.
These signatures may be distinctive <fex>of the entire Chlamydiales order</fex>.
The almonds had a bitter <fex> taste</fex>.
There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
